3: Wanshi, why did you put such a strange tasting can in your maintenance capsule?
Uh... You ate it?
Not even Camu could've choked that down.
I could smell it a mile away. I thought your recovery room had been raided by mustard gas.
Kamui's noisy voice projected from the direction of Wanshi's recovery room.
Through the opened door of the recovery room, Wanshi sees the cans that he had put in the cabinet.
Kamui accidentally discovered a slightly swollen metal can in Wanshi's storage. It reminded Wanshi of his distant past.
Broken stone slabs and steel bars stand in the ruins. Smoke and dust in the air cast an oppressive haze on the area.
The surrounding craters speak to the kind of devastation wrought on this land.
Oil flows quietly along the terrain, filling craters along the way and finally gathering in recesses of the street.
A pair of military boots steps into a puddle, causing black ripples to disturb the oily surface.
The ripples bump into a mechanical arm submerged in the oil. Right at that moment, the mechanical arm seems to receive a signal, stirring it from silence.
It twitches wildly, grabbing onto the surrounding wreckage as it tries to free its broken limbs from the crushing weight of the ruins.
Finally, its attempt at dragging itself out is ended by the dull thud of a gunshot.
Looks like there are some stragglers. I thought all of Corrupted near the southern defensive line were alerted by the large-scale clean-up and suppression operation led by the Egrets.
The shooter slings the rifle on his shoulder while it is still cooling down, then looks down at the Corrupted he had just stopped from moving.
Wanshi, the file I'm looking for still isn't popping up on the scan. What about you?
Yawn—
Come on. Is that you yawnin' again? Are you workin' or what?
Um... You could say that...
Wanshi, Wanshi?
Dammit... He fell asleep again.
Forget it. I'll just...
Troy... You should probably lie down for a second.
Hearing the sudden sound on the silent comms, the Construct known as Troy performs a tactical roll to the side, avoiding a burst of air as it ruptures by his ear.
It was the sound of the attack from a large Corrupted suddenly appearing in front of Troy. Building debris and the remains of smaller Corrupted fall off its torso.
As Troy raises his gun and aims at the large Corrupted, a silver orb of light fires from the direction where he last stood.
Following the blast, the Corrupted begins to disintegrate from one of its arms. The mechanical joints shatters into fragments and splashes into the oil-filled crater.
Finally, a silver orb of light penetrates the fractured memory shell towering off to the side. It falls backward from the inertia of the impact, leaving mechanical residue on the ground.
Yawns— Another bites the dust. Take five.
Troy gets up and looks back. He sees Wanshi, who is standing on the overlooking precipice off in the distance, stretch his arms and then lay down lethargically.
Hey, knock it off! Quit sleeping on the job!
Relax. That was the last one...
Hmph, what makes you say that?
While you were running around looking for the data files...
I was here scanning for enemies and taking them out. I didn't even have to move an inch. Quick and easy...
Fine, whatever.
Troy sighs, then climbs over a structure and continues to search the ruins.
Anyway, the ruins sure are quiet.
Hey, Wanshi. When did you join Strike Hawk?
Now that you're awake, I figured I'd ask while I still had the chance. You've been dozing on and off, so I didn't want to bother.
Sigh... Doze off again?
It just happed by some weird twist of fate.
Perhaps due to Wanshi's sudden response over the comms or because he was not expecting that answer, either way, Troy slips while climbing the crumbling wall to the ruins.
Right as Troy is about to fall off the wall, he hears the revving of an engine underfoot. A faint white light appears underneath him, steadily catching him in midair.
Phew... Scared me there for a second.
Troy pats his chest with a free hand, then places his feet back on a sturdy section of the crumbling wall. After regaining his footing, he continues to climb.
Fate, huh? That's nice.
I heard that scouts don't have to go to the front line. That's why I joined.
But you Strike Hawks are in a league of your own.
Yawn... Like... some sorta elite team?
Of course. What scout hasn't heard of Strike Hawk?
But don't elite teams usually have a human called... um... a commandant?
That's just an ordinary elite team. Don't you know who your Captain is?
Chrome is a perfect Construct equipped with a specialized Inver-Device who is responsible for serving as the team's commandant.
Oh, and the other Strike Hawks are equally one in a million. Any mission with Strike Hawk is virtually guaranteed to be a success.
You don't say... I just thought there was something special about our Captain and Kamui.
How could you be so oblivious to all of this? You don't know how much I envy you.
As for me, my combat abilities are as ordinary as they come.
All I can do is run fast and keep my mouth shut. That's why Commander Nikola assigned me to this mission.
Honestly, I may not be afraid to fight Corrupted, but I won't be first in line to fight them head-on.
So, thanks for the help just now.
Hmph, it was nothing.
Haha, no need to be so modest. It was an honest compliment. Just take it.
After climbing to the top of the crumbling wall while chatting with Wanshi, Troy can now scan the large area below.
Troy sees patches of Corrupted and human remains piled up on the ground, alluding to a tragic battle that had taken place here.
Troy bows his head in a moment of silence, then jumps down from the crumbling wall and continues onward.
Surely enough... This city was lost during the Post-Pandemic Age, too.
But scenes like this bloodbath here are the real reason I won't step foot on the front line.
It's ridiculous that soldiers pay their lives in exchange for a total retreat.
We're supposedly bound by duty to carry out orders.
But every time I see these scenes, I still can't help ask these questions from the bottom of my heart.
However, the answers to these questions are even more troubling...
Troy smiles somberly, then tapped the position of his temple, causing a fluorescent panel to pop up in front of his eyes.
It's not here either.
Wanshi, when will this endless war end?
Uh... I don't know.
What a pity. If one person dies on the battlefield, they're a hero. Ten people, they're martyrs. One million people, they're just a statistic.
We already sacrificed so many people.
Is it true that our mission will only truly be complete once we achieve victory and humanity has taken back Earth?
...I don't know. But I had a dream about us winning the war recently.
A spark spreads from a faint orb of light, igniting change all around the world.
Finally, the spark ignites the entire Earth, but gradually fades after burning...
Even if we win a temporary victory against the Corrupted, the Punishing Virus won't be eradicated so easily...
It was just a dream though.
It's just not a dream...
The Punishing Virus has caught us off guard more than once.
Just as human beings have spent millions of years building their own civilization on the surface of Earth...
The Punishing Virus is also adapting and corrupting the land in its own way.
If we don't find a way to eradicate it...
When conditions such as environment and time align, one day the Punishing Virus will evolve into an existence beyond our comprehension.
Well... But at least it hasn't come to that yet, has it?
It's always best to plan ahead, but we still need to live in the present. Right?
Uh... Sure.
The comm link becomes silent again. Thoughts fills the M.I.N.D.s of Troy and Wanshi. They continue to perform their respective tasks in radio silence.
